DOC.brief_summary: Patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention with a residual high platelet reactivity despite oral clopidogrel are at increased risk of ischaemic complications. The strategies to overcome the issue consist of switch to a more potent antiplatelet medications including prasugrel or ticagrelor. Economic constrains of many countries still do not allow wide reimbursement of newer antiplatelet agents. Therefore a strategy to personalise treatment according to genotype and phenotype characteristics of the patient may provide an attractive solution combining high clinical efficacy with low budget impact.
